aboutAshram.heading: About Sri Devraha Baba Ashram
aboutAshram.subtitle:
Sri Devraha Baba Ashram
Brahm Rishi Shri Shri Dev Das Ji Maharaj
aboutAshram.description:
Here, away from the noisy streets, in the gardens of Vrindavan, amazing games of Radha and Krishna take place at all times. Krishna's friends, the cows, find shelter and love in this blessed place.

In the ancient city of Vrindavan, on the banks of the sacred Yamuna River, there is an Ashram of the world-famous sage Sri Devraha Baba, one of the greatest siddha yogis of India in the parampara of Sri Ramanuja Acharya. People of all castes and classes came to him to pay obeisances from different parts of India and many countries of the world. It was attended by Indian Prime Minister Indira Gandhi and her son Rajiv, the first President of the USSR Mikhail Gorbachev, as well as other politicians, saints, yogis, priests, rich and poor—all came for the blessing of Sri Devraha Baba—the true spiritual incarnation of love.

Today, the ashram is run by the successor of Sri Devraha Baba, Mahatma Sri Devadas Maharaj, following the instructions of the great sage.

adoptACowCTA.description: Join us in our mission to provide a loving home and care for cows in need. Your adoption can make a significant impact on their lives and promote compassion towards all living beings.

cowCarousel.heading: Meet Our Sacred Cows
cowCarousel.description: Each cow in our ashram holds a special place in our hearts. Get to know them!

faq.title: Frequently Asked Questions
faq.description: Find answers to common queries below.

1.question: How can I donate to the cows?
1.answer: You can donate online through our donation page or visit our ashram in person.

2.question: Where is the ashram located?
2.answer: The ashram is located in Vrindavan, India. You can find it on Google Maps.

3.question: Can I visit the cows in person?
3.answer: Yes, visitors are welcome to the ashram to meet and care for the cows.

AboutPage.heading: Welcome to Sri Devraha Baba Ashram
AboutPage.subheading: A sacred place for the preservation and well-being of cows.
AboutPage.hinduDescription: Hindu religion considers cows as goddesses, as it bestows us with life-saving milk. Even Lord Krishna is known as Govinda and Gopala—'Lord and Guardian of Cows.' As per Hinduism, the cow is symbolic of wealth and good fortune and is worshiped as Kamdhenu, the sacred cow, which is considered the source of all prosperity. Vedas link cows to well-being and prosperity in the household. Sri Devraha Baba once said, 'A Hindu can be recognized by the way he loves and worships cows.' Baba believed cows will one day save Bharat Varsh (India).
AboutPage.guardianDescription: You can become the guardian of one or more cows, visit them in the ashram, or receive updates remotely. All friends of our Goshala cows always receive special blessings from Guruji Mahatma Sri Devdas Ji Maharaj.
AboutPage.nutritionDescription: In the Sri Devraha Baba Ashram goshala, the mother cows receive full, balanced, and high-quality nutrition. We select eco-friendly feeds from trusted suppliers near Vrindavan to ensure their health and happiness.
AboutPage.cowImportanceTitle: The Sacred Role of Cows in Humanity
AboutPage.cowImportanceDescription: The cow is an amazing divine being carrying powerful vibrations of the Universe. She provides milk, ghee, butter, and medicinal products, playing an essential role in Ayurveda and human well-being.
AboutPage.preservationDescription: Previously, there were more than a hundred breeds of cows in India, but today only 32 remain. The Ashram of Sri Devraha Baba is dedicated to preserving and reproducing these rare breeds.

CowsPage.heading: Meet Our Cows
CowsPage.description: Each cow in our ashram holds a special place in our hearts. Get to know them!

Footer.description: Kamdhenuseva is an initiative by Daya Devraha Ashram dedicated to the welfare of cows. Your contributions help provide food, shelter, and medical care to support and protect these sacred beings.
